codigo.python: def add_many(operand1, *operands): Sum = operand1 for op in operands: Sum += op return Sum add_many for op in operands operand1=127;operands=1, 3, 5, 7, 20 operand1=12;operands=1, 3, 5, 20 operand1=1;operands=1, 3, 5 operand1=112;operands=1, 3, 5,10,11,56,342,2 operand1=12132;operands=1, 3, 5,10,11,56,342 Funcion que suma todos los valores de operands a operand1

import math
def sieve(n): primes = list(range(2,n+1)) max = math.sqrt(n) num = 2 while num < max: i = num while i <= n: i += num if i in primes: primes.remove(i) for j in primes: if j > num: num = j break return primes sieve while i <= n n=8 n=12 n=14 n=15 n=18 Funcion que retorna todos los numeros primos hasta n

def pascal(n): if n == 1: return [1] else: line = [1] previous_line = pascal(n-1) for i in range(len(previous_line)-1): line.append(previous_line[i] + previous_line[i+1]) line += [1] return line pascal for i in range(len(previous_line)-1) n=3 n=4 n=5 n=6 n=7 Funcion que genera un triangulo de Pascal de nivel=n
